text: Bottle (tagged 2016/08/30): Poured translucent to slightly cloudy deep gold with a bubbly white calming head, sediment. Classic aroma of Belgian yeast, fruity esters, banana, coriander/spice, banana, and light floral notes. Sweet taste, alcohol traces, bit of spiciness. Medium body, oily to watery, light dry finish and a really nice effervescent lively carbonation thats not over the top. Overall: Longstanding classic, true to the style and easy-drinking. Just a touch too much sweetness for my personal liking.

Pours a clear golden color with a pretty big foamy white head. Lots of carbonation. Nose of banana, brown sugar, some spices, cloves maybe. Lots of esters. Taste is pretty sweet, easily drinkable. Not much of a finish in alcohol or in hops. Very well balanced but might be missing a little bit of something. Still above average.

Une bière ambrée, avec un doigt de carbonatation et peu deffervescence. Au nez, la levure belge lemporte avec une signature un peu poivrée. En bouche, cest assez sucrée avec la levure qui est aussi présente quen bouche. Ya de leffervescence en masse, du sucre et de la levure. Un peu caramélisé. Un peu moins équilibré.

From my hermano: pours lightly hazy, light gold with a white head. Aroma is banana, spice, fleurs, and light fruitiness. Taste is pretty sweet... lingering sugary aftertaste. Medium body. Fleurs in the taste. Not really my favorite.

Look: first glass is clear and golden and the next doses are hazy.

Aroma: peppery, dusty, estery.

Taste: dry with prominent spicy bitterness.
Flavour: fresh ground pepper, dry apricotes, homemade apricote brandy, white wine, flowers.

Very good dry and spicy tripel.

medium aroma  flowers, a bit of wheat malt, white wine.
medium, dry and sour taste  dry white wine, a bit of hop bitterness, fruits, flowers, some cognac notes. very good!

BOTTLE 50 CL shared. Very bright fruity aroma, into the lemony, even white wine territory. Well carbonated. Dry taste, with a tiny bit of sugars, unripe stone fruit, lemony. Tart dry, slightly hoppy finish with traces of warming alcohol. An excellent, dry tripel.
Clear straw, medium head. Intense aroma of Sweet tropical fruit and dried bananas. Sweet but dry and zesty. Lightly sterile at the end.

Top dog in a classic Quebec beer series. A big fluffy and well laced white head on a lemon juice/straw coloured body. The nose features bready malt, spice and banana. This is a well blended, refreshing and tasty triple. The taste profile leads with sweet malt and banana from the Belgian yeast. Spices such as coriander and cloves provide accents as do touches of orange and tropical fruit. Smooth, a bit slick and well balanced. The fine effervescence pumps up the taste and adds to the clean finish.

Slightly cloudy golden coloured body with a hint of honey and light orange around the edges, all with a two centimetre tall off-white head. Aroma of honey, light grain, smooth coriander seed and a bit of curacao and full oranges. Medium to Full-bodied; Super sweet flavour of oranges, grain, alcohol, honey, coriander seed and a little bit of grass. Aftertaste is complex with a nice smooth sweet flavour with honey up front, some light grassy and herbal elements followed by some oranges and velvety yeast flavours. Overall, a nice and rich beer that is still somehow easy to drink with some nice complexities on the finish. I sampled this stubby montreal styled 500 mL bottle purchased a few minutes earlier on 18-September-2016 for CA$4,89 at Rue Berri (Berri-UQAM Station) sampled in my hotel room in Montreal on 18-September-2016.

opalescent pale yellow colour, large white head; aroma of bread, apricot, intensive Belgian yeast, cheesy notes, maybe some citruses and floral notes, too; taste is the same with the dominance of yeast and fruitiness; extraordinary tripel!

Certaines belges sont plus axées sur laspect phénolique, dautres sur celui fruité. Ici, on a droit à une Triple où la levure belge joue un beau rôle sur les deux plans: les épices et les arômes dagrumes, voire de poire sont bien équilibrés. Effervescence plutôt élevée.

Bouteille 500 ml de la Cave à Bières - Yverdon (CH). Blonde à légers reflets verts sous une mousse dense et pure, très effervescente et dentelles au verre. Nez dalcool, fruité citron-abricot, épices et caramel, relent houblonné. Le goût est doux, fruité et alcooleux, avec une acidité idoine, sucré-caramel avec un amer damande, des notes de levure. Bière chaleureuse et gourmande. Etiquette buvard délavée.
Bottle thanks to cards04. Light yellow and light in taste. Yeasty. Banana lemon. Decent.

Slightly opaque hay-coloured beer with a foamy white head. Nice bubbliness.
Smell is classic Belgian: sweet grainy grassy with a subtle bitterness. Touch of whie pepper, coriander, hint of peaches. Bit of malty sourness.
Taste is sweet watery bitter with a hint typical French sourness. Smooth and silky with a watery creamy finish. Minerals, slight hint of vanilla.

Tap / Tirador.
@ Irreale, Madrid, España.
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Yeast, sweet, citrusy / Levadura, dulce, citrico.
Pours a cloudy lemon color. Aromas of canned corn, bread, Belgian yeast. Flavours are sweet Belgian candy with a sharp bitter finger. Very effervescent. Beautiful looking beer

Bottle, less than 3 months old. Very cloudy golden pour with a white head. Aroma is citrus zest, a little bready. Taste is sweet citrus zest, very bready, some spice and candy notes. Quite flavourful and heavy.

50cl bottle, served in Trappist glass. Pours golden with medium white head. Aroma is banana, caramel, yeast and fruits. Taste is the same but the banana flavour really dominates. The yeast plays an important role here. Its very balanced, smooth, easy drinkable and the alcohol barely appears. Medium body, perfect carbonation. Excellent Tripel.

Bright hazy straw color, almost golden. Thick extra foamy 5 finger head lasting for more than 15 minutes and creating a high foam island eatable with a spoon. Strong legs and extra powerful but delicate activity.

Aromas and flavors of fruits, citrus, honey or caramel, herbal and floral spices. Well intensified flavors of rich and pleasant sweet apple and lemony taste with some faint bitter spices making it quite accessible.

Slick medium body with champagne like carbonation. Perfectly balanced finish ending with a slightly spicy and smoky bitter orange/clove like feel.

Overall : A strong craft; Delicious flavors, well balanced in all aspects, highly refreshing, perfectly spiced, but slightly too vinous.

A typical Belgian aroma, Belgian yeast, a hint of clove and spice with a hint of lemon. A great looking beer, hazy gold color with lasting white head and lots of lacing. Taste of clove and honey with a creamy feel and a Belgian yeast finish.

Poured from a bottle. Clear golden color, full frothy white head. Sour clove aroma. Medium body with a smooth clove flavor and a nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared. Rich cereals with a cake edge, dried fruits, raisin, yeast, honey, touch of lemon, gentle spicy finish. Smooth and delicious brew in this apparently solid series.

(Charlevoix Dominus Vobiscum Triple) Bottle 500ml served into a big tulip at home, ABV 9%
Deep golden yellow colour on the body, clear, with lots of activity in the glass. Tall and thick, snow-white head, with very good retention.
Aroma has light malts, floral notes, peaches, citrus zest, very inviting.
Taste follows, light malty and sweet taste, then peaches, some bubblegum on the finish even, grass, mildly bitter.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Nice one.

Bottle 50cl, a cloudy amber beer with good head. Nose is intense on belgian yeast, quince and ripped apples. Aroma is on sweet oranges, quince, ripped apples, sweet, bit massive, lot of fruit and ripped fruit, drinkable.
Peruslagerin väri. Intensiivinen puinen nenääntunkeutuva tuoksu. Intensiivisen alkoholinen vetinen suutuntuma, makean juuston kera nautittuna makeaa alkoholia, kuivuutta.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 341 ml bottle. Courtesy of Euphemos.
Cloudy golden color with a small white head.
Yeast, bitterness, bready malt and dryness in the aroma. 
Alcohol... badness... dryness... badness!

Robe blonde limpide au col de mousse blanc, léger et crépitant. Arômes de levures, banane, orange, abricot. Beaucoup de phénols de fermentation qui laissent échapper du clou de girofle et muscade. Nez agréable mais manque dintensité. En bouche, beaucoup de levures et épices. Un bon malt sucré et de légers fruits comme orange, citron et abricot. Une finale où le clou de girofle et la muscade ressortent beaucoup. Texture plutôt mince pour une tripel, corps moyen et alcool discret. Pas dune grande complexité mais reste une excellente entrée en matière pour le style.

Pours hazy golden with thin white head. Nose is fruity. Aromas are fruits, citrus, some spices and candi. Fizzy carbonation, foamy texture. Long spicy finish. Very nice triple.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bought a 500ml bottle which is a little bit heavy to try and knock back in one go. Smells sour and malty. Tastes sharp and strong. As far as Belgians go it lacks a lot of the complexity and delicacy that I look for in them.
Tap at vices&versa. Golden with small head. Light sweetness. Understated spice. Moderate booze.
Tres proche dune biere trappiste une bonne souche de levure.................................

A lively beer pours into the table. A hazy, dark yellow beer, a head is medium and blond. Aroma has fruits and aromatic flowers, sweetness of honey, some spices. Taste is fruitful, flowers, honey, hint of spices. Medium bodied, fresh, nice carbonation. Nicely aromatic with flowers.

Jaune brillante et un peu bru.eux avec une grande robe blanche. Larôme épicé avec plein de fruits et un peu du sucre. Le goût est similar et fraîche avec une palate léger et plein du corps au même temps. Exceptionnelle.
Pours a clear golden yellow with lots of white head. Smells of Belgian yeast and fruity esters, candied fruit. Frothy carbonation sweet and mildly bitter on the finish. Nice Triple.
Je nai pas trop trop aimé: assez forte mais équilibrée, elle a un côté amère au final.

A palackban történő utóerjedés heves vérmérséklettel ruházza fel a hosszú idő óta az üvegben lapuló testet, bombaként robbantja le a kupakot a nekiiramodó tripel-zuhatag. Festői színei opálos gabonalé körvonalait hordozzák, illata nemkülönben intenzív maláta, parfümösen fűszeres élesztő főszereplésétől harsog, aromás komló határozott megjelenése színesíti a mennyeien krémes kompozíciót. Vibráló és fűszeres, telt ízű, mégis élénk a szerkezet, kiegyensúlyozott kortyai által bepillantást nyerhetünk a klasszikus belga karakterek világába - megnyerő tripel került elő a kanadai főzde üstjeiből.

Really nice Belgian. Has all the expected flavours of yeast, bread, grains, spices, alcohol heat, etc. What really set this one apart from me was the bottle conditioned carbonation. A lot of Belgians lately have had a super abbrasive and unnatural carbonation level, but with Vobiscum Tripel it was soft, bubbly, and perfect.

Yellow body with hints of amber and a lacy white head. Strong fruit aroma of apricots. Effervescent and sweet taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is cloudy straw with a fizzy white cap. Nose is boozy and yeasty, with apricot, pale grain, honey with herbal notes. Taste-wise its sweet and fruity and boozy but nothing is overpowering. Finish is dry with lingering booze warmth. This stuff is intense, but also scary drinkable.

500ml bottle share with wife from Pasquier. Aroma: lemon, apricot, floral, Belgian yeast. App: hazy straw with medium white head and some lacing. Taste and palate: medium-full body, light sweetness, light acidity and alcohol finish. Overall: a really good Triple. Taste and palate is awesome. The acidity finish is really enjoyable. The texture of the beer is really great too.

Bottle 500ml. [ As Charlevoix Dominus Vobiscum Triple ].Unclear matt medium yellow color with many tiny sized body particles, a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, herbs, moderate yeasty, minerals, spicy, toothpaste. Flavor is moderate sweet with a long duration, sweet malt - yeast, spicy, light minerals. Quit easy to drink and balanced. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150116]
My favortie non-belgian tripel. Great candied fruit aroma and taste; well balanced. Not a charicature of belgian tripels, rather a very well done interpretation.

Pours a clear light golden with a medium white head that leaves sticky lacing. Nose is of peppery alcohol, flowery alcohol and alcohol. Good phenols, never overwhelming. Taste is moderately sweet and peppery. Peppery fruits. Alcohol is present but never too hot. Body is light to medium and carbonation medium-medium-high (a touch too high if you ask me). Mouthfeel is airy at least. Overall a nice classic from Quebec, forgotten in those "new beer everyday" days but still really imposing.

Im fairly new to craft beers, but this one will have me going back to the store for more. Reading the other ratings, this brewer has many fine brews that are worth trying. Yeasty aroma at first but it opens up to a malty bready nose. Massive rocky, white head that lasts with excellent lacing. Bottle conditioned light amber color . Incredibly fizzy. Yeasty sweet bitter taste. Dry, sharp and clean taste. Many other raters claim its more of a German Hefeweizen than a Belgian Triple. I need more experience. Great sipping beer! Cheers.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy yellow with an off-white head and lots of tiny floaties. Aroma is sweet, malty, citrus, fruity and spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. 160115

Bottle, 9%. Unclear yellow with floaties and small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, peel, hop and spices. Flavour is malt, yeast, floral, herbs, spices, medium sweet, minerals, notes of alcohol, hop, notes of perfume and medium bitter.

The experience starts with the 500ml custom bottle and its distinctive artwork that I think is pretty cool and stands out on the shelves. At first glance, you have a foggy golden robe showing tons of fine bubbles topped by an eggshell head that I found very airy. The head slowly shifts to a thin layer and offers a minimal rough lacing. The nose is aromatic and spicy with notes of fresh cilantro and grainy malt presence. Youll also get a sweaty or soapy undertone from the yeasts that I personally found less interesting. The attack is a bit sweet but quickly shifts to bready malts, again with the soapy undertone of the yeasts and a hoppy finale delivering a slight aftertaste. A pleasant warmth and sting from the alcohol gives a nice density and roundness. Kind of surprised the alcohol was so apparent, since only standing at 9% ABV. The mouthfeel is also sharp and dry, contributing to the complexity of the product. Overall this is a good full-bodied, robust triple I found interesting and a beer you could shelf for up to 3 years to make it develop complexity.

Bouteille 500ml. Blonde paille, mousse blanche avec dentelle. Arôme dalcool, levure. Goût, pain, levure, alcool. Palais modérée. Arrière gout faible, sucré. Cest bon, cest rafraichissant. Un produit remarquable.
500ml bottle. Hazy golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are bread, honey, apricot, peach, banana, spices, candi sugar and alcohol with floral and fruity notes. Medium body, oily texture.

500ml bottle [little gusher]. Hazy golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Yeasty aroma, notes of apple purée and oat flakes, some yeast spiciness, hints of apple, apricot, mirabelle and peach. Taste is yeasty, minimally spicy, fruity notes of apple, apricot, mirabelle and peach, a minimally sweet touch of oat flakes. Very clean, without edges - and therefore almost a bit boring.
Pours amber. Aroma of yeast and champagne. Tastes of the same. Lingering aftertaste.

On tap at Bier Markt Montreal. A pale straw gold color is very light for a 9% triple. The aroma is Belgian yeast, bready & sweet triple but not that fruity or complex. Quite full bodied, the flavor delivers creamy vanilla, fruitiness and smooth wheatiness. Quite nice but not exactly screaming classic Belgian triple to me.

50 cl bottle @ tiong. Bottled 26.11.2013
A gusher. Aroma has soapy citrus, grain, some hay and apricot. Flavour has strong apricot tones, some soapy citrus and grassy hops. Finishes with sweet fruity tones and hints of fruit candy. Too sweet and a bit disappointing. Works in a small amounts though.

50 cl bottle. Bottled on 26.11.2013.
A gusher. Pours cloudy golden color with a large white head. Earthy, herbal aroma, some yeast and lemon. Citric yeasty flavor, apricot, some toffee, grass and mild spicy notes. Strong carbonation, sourish palate, surprisingly sweet finish. This might be more refreshing if the yeast hadnt mixed from the get-go. Decent.
4334

500 ml bottle. Gusher. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a small head. Aroma of grains, bread, yeast and citrusy spiciness. Somehow a hefeweizen kind of aroma. Flavour of sweet maltiness, residual sugar, some white bread, yeast and some citrus. Medium bodied. Feels heavy because of the amount of sugar. Way too sweet for my taste. Would not guess this is a tripel.

500ml bottle

Pours hazy yellow with a massive white head. Aroma of spicy and yeasty with some ripe fruitness and citrus. Taste is sweet, yeasty and stuffy with some spices, ripe fruitness and citrusy notes. Finish is yeasty, stuffy and quite sweet with warming alcohol and ripe fruits. Okay, quite heavy and sweet tripel.
Dominus font dexcellentes bières, cependant celle-ci ne ma pas suprise comme les autres lors de sa dégustation.
Dune couleur blonde ambrée, elle dégage une bonne effervescence. Au pif larôme est floral, malté & sucré. Son goût est bien malté, légerement épicé, subtilement sucré. Rafraîchissante. ;)

Bottle from Darbys Liquor Store, Vancouver, bottled 2013-06-04Hazy deep blond color, with fine perlage, generous and persistent compact head. The aroma has the elegance and spicy depth of true Belgian ales, with nuances of malt, rosemary, sage, heather honey, alcohol, phenol; fresh fruity and floral impression too. The mouthfeel is lean, yet with moderate sweetness; good malt flavor, with elegant spice profile, coriander and cloves; very smooth, with low but correct level of bitterness and a light herbal touch in the end; very good work with the yeast.Excellent beer, to drink slowly in order to appreciate the details.

Bottle @ tasting, shared by DutchDrebus. Pours a light hazy golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is very yeasty and Belgianny, some booze detected. Flavor is very sweet and light alcoholic, touch of banana and other subtle fruits. Light carbonation, decent Belgian clone.

Bottle shared by Dutchdrebus when he came by to wave me and MrHangover goodbye (we were going on holiday) with tears in his eyes and wood in his pants -so he said himself-. Gusher! Hazy a bit pale yellow color, medium sized white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is orangepeel, lightly malts and yeasty. Taste yeast, orangepeel, lightly malts. You know what, this is a real Belgian Beer clone, thats for sure. But is this really a typical Belgian tripel? Imo its not. Not a bad beer, but Im not convinced. To me its a Belgian tripel clone mixed with a German Hefeweizen. Nevertheless, if you drink this solely because you want to drink a decent beer, no remarks at all.

Bottle @ benzai shared by me. Hazy yellow with a medium to full sized white head. Smells some mint, Belgian yeast, malts, sweetish, some banana and some wheat. Tastes sweet, malty, some Belgian yeast, some wheat and banana. Medium body, soft carbo.

Aroma is fruit and lemon grass. Some sulphur presence aswell. Taste is of belgian sugar, some dark fruits. Finishes remarkably smooth. Clear gold body with a very nice thick pillow whote head that retains well.

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy pale gold with a three finger foamy white head. Aromas of yeast, lemon, peppercorn, and big mineral notes. Mildly sweet with mineral water notes, light dried apricot, a light alcohol burn, light lemon candy, black pepper and spice (clove, mild cinnamon) in the finish. Man, this brewery appears to make nothing but fantastic beer.
At BBF. Clear golden colour with white head. Honey, fruity aroma. Sweet, malty, honey taste, Medium body.
Belle blonde plutôt limpide. De grosses bulles forment un beau collet. Belle arôme. Bonne bière .
Light yellow body with lemon foam head very carbonated. Sweet with a nice bitterness that's unique for a triple. Verdant and brothy.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Bière jaune, dorée, or liquide, voilée de très fines particules, effervescence moyenne-bonne, surmontée dun col blanc immaculé, mousseux et rocailleux, très dense, moyennement large, et qui se réduit tout doucement en laissant une fine dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes de pain frais, pâtisserie, miel et sucre dorge, avec dabondants effluves fruités, fruits tropicaux (banane, mangue, cantaloup) et fruits du verger (pêche, poire), et de tout aussi abondants effluves épicés (clou de girofle, coriandre, gingembre, muscade, poivre). Le nez est très agréable, bien intense, et adéquatement complexe. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, breuvage mousseux, belle rondeur, onctuosité intéressante au palais, légèrement liquoreuse. Au goût, on retrouve pas mal le nez (pain frais/pâtisserie, miel/sucre dorge, fruits, épices), avec également un alcool bien présent en bouche, ainsi quun houblon floral qui apporte une finale à lamertume de faible à modérée. Je pense que cette amertume est justement un peu trop présente pour le style, sinon les saveurs sont bien intégrées les unes aux autres, et la bière est sèche et réconfortante. Excellent produit!

Color oro algo tupido con densa espuma blanca. Aromas frescos herbales y afrutados de manzana y uva. En boca es igualmente fresca y sorprendentemente ligera, el sabor es dulce y afrutado con toques ácidos. Muy rica.
Taste is complex, balance of spices and sweetness, with long bitter finish that is both hoppy and a bit alcoholic. Mouthfeel is excellently rich and creamy, lively and smooth.

2013 bottle, cloudy yellow pour, lots of white light head (just like in the photo, clap clap).Big yeasty aroma, lemon, spices, melon fruit, very atypical of the style. Taste, follows the aroma almost in lockstep, yeasty, spices, semi dry finish, that is slightly bitter, very mellow, booze comes through a touch in the aftermath of the finish. A nice example of the style.

2010 bottle from the rotbox. the rate starts with dumping beer all over my laptop. paper towels offered. back to the brew! Warning: not a fan of tripels in general. aroma of sweet, cotton candy, candied sugar, sweet suckers. grape bubblegum. not offensive, but not very inviting given my preferences. taste is sweet candied doughy booze cake. frosting. a fine candy brew, but not quite to my liking.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a fizzy two finger white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, fruit and spices. Flavor was lightly sweet with candi sugar, fruit, sweet pale malts, yeast, honey and some belgium spices. Medium body. lively carbonation. slightly dry finish.

Pours bright and clear gold with a big yeast filled aroma. Light fruity notes with citrus and spice esters. A bit sweet with toasted caramel malts with notes of honey, lemon and apple. Loads of yeast and estery flavours with mild sweetness and crisp finish. Nice brew overall.

Bottle to American pint glass
The nose it primarily yeast and yeast notes like leather, dough, horse blanket, but then a subtle sweetness comes through; something like apple and maybe a little citrus. Its a crystal clear yellow, with light effervescence and a soapy and cloudy, long lasting bright white head. The taste is as expected, sweet up front, loads of yeast and then finishing with some bitterness and alcohol.
A classic triple as its got it all; sweet, bitter, yeast, and alcohol and it looks great.

Goldgelbe Farbe, trüb. Sehr schöner Schaum der sich lange hält. Geruch malzig süß, Honig, Kräuter. Geschmack malzig süß, Honig, Gewürze.
Ein sehr gutes Bier!
500 ml. bottle. Pours a mostly clear gold with a nice white head. Aroma of fruit, spices, malt, yeast, and florals. Taste is the same. Excellent Abbey Tripel.

Couleur dorée trouble avec un beau col blanc. Nez complexe de fruits,houblons et dépices. En bouche fruits et épices avec une finale légèrement amère. Une bière bien construite assez complexe. Je la trouve quand même difficile a boire. Ce nest pas tout a fait mon genre de bière.

Jai envie de dire "bonne petite bière!" mais, après y avoir goûtée, on ne peut définitivement pas parler dune petite bière! La Dominus Vobiscum Triple est une bière ronde et profonde (pensez "La Fin Du Monde" ou "La Seigneuriale") qui offre beaucoup : levure/épices et houblons.

 Il y a un je-ne-sais-quoi qui méverve un peu dans la plupart des bières de cette brasserie, une sensation neutre/basique (le contraire de "acide/intense"), que je naime pas particulièrement, cest difficile à expliquer! Mais, une fois ce petit désagrément passé, nous avons ici clairement à faire à une très bonne bière.

(surprisingly never rated this shyte - 3 y.o. bottle) pours hazy bright golden with a ncie white cap, some retention and lacing. very fruity - apricots and peaches - borderline spoiled fruits, white grapes along with their acidity, coriander and other spices - ginger and cardamom maybe, honeyed malts, candi, yeast. lively to average carbonation, medium body - oily, ncie grassy-spicy finish. ageing is not suited for this beer.
33cl bottle at Bierfestival Beerse. Hazy goldblond coloured beer with small white head and no carbonation. Fruited hoppy and malty hinted aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped sweet malty.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 blonde pris au verre a la microbrasserie. arome léger d?agrume avec soupçon de foin. en bouche tres petite amertume et acidité

- Arôme dalcool avec un teinte dorange
- Ressemble à un blanche plus quà une blonde. Mousse beaucoup au versement et garde un bon filet qui reste sur la surface.
- À un bon goût dalcool et des teintes dorange
- Reste moyennement longtemps en bouche. Une belle effervescence qui donne une bonne amertume courte en fin de bouche.

Au final, cest une bonne bière qui reste éclipsé par la Fin du Monde. Elle reste une bière recommandable!
Charlevoix is my favorite Quebec brewery. This triple is a treat. From the beautiful full head and the golden color to the fruity and yeasty smell and taste it is just a treat.

Bouteille 500ml. Couleur orangée translucide, mousse blanche aérienne et persistante laissant une dentelle floconneuse. Arôme de pomme, levure, malt. Goût de levure, gâteau des anges, malt. Carbonation élevée, corps moyen.

500ml bottle. Bottled on 2013/04/19. Pours a clear yellow with a frothy, snow white, three finger head. A small amount of bubbles can be seen streaming to the top. Head thins to half a finger and produces modest lacing. As you make your way through the bottle it gets more clouded in pour. Aroma has notes of yeast, spice, citrus and other fruits, especially banana, and a hint of sugary bubblegum. Taste is semi sweet. Yeast, fruit, and spice fills the mouth and produces a moderately warm and sweet aftertaste.Medium body. High carbonation. Very lively.A Classic taste very well done. Worth keeping on hand for those special people.

50 cL bottle from State Line. Pours a hazy golden color with a very large tan head. Good head retention. 200th Abbey Tripel rating! Aroma of strong bready malts with some caramel, spice, citrus, nuttiness. The taste is stone fruits, spice, bread, more stone fruits, strawberries, cherries, yeast, a bit of cheese. Faint booze, lingering spice, medium-full bodied. Quite complex and quite nice even with some age on it (Bottle Mar. 17 2010). Well done.
Extrêmement croustillant, bonne charge de saveurs fruités, légèrement caramélisées, insistance modérée de la levure, conception impeccable.

Excellente bière, et surtout du Québec. Un privilège de pouvoir la boire. Très bon goût!

Ketail

Combination of 2 ratings: December 2010 and June 2013.
Aroma: spices, cinnamon, Tropical fruits, candy, banana. A complex and wide palette of aromas. Hoppy nose that I had in 2010 no longer there.
Appearance: Very clear gold / blond, with a very thick foamy head lasting several minutes. Doesnt stick much.
Taste: In the purist tradition of monastic Belgium beers. Very spicy with a hint of acidity. Notes of pepper mixed with an extreme sparkling mouth feel. Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée-orangée et voilée. Nez de levures fuitées (agrumes, surtout doranges, traces de poires, de pommes et de pêche) et épicées (coriandre piquante, traces de gingembre et de poivre),  de grains de céréales sucrées avec des notes de houblon floral et des traces dalcool doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement plutôt élevé et une texture moyennement crémeuse aux notes sirupeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes sucrées, léger de pêche, notes de pommes et de poires) et dépices (coriandre piquante, traces de gingembre, de poivre et de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût de grains de céréales sucrées avec des notes de miel et des traces de caramel doux et de pain et puis en finale, lon retrouve une moyenne-légère amertume asséchante de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses et léger dalcool doux légèrement réchauffant. Post-goût moyen-long et sec, moyen-léger amer dalcool doux, de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses ainsi quavec un léger goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes) aux traces épicées (poivre).

La Dominus Vobiscum triple est une bière forte, à 9% dalcool, que japprécie particulièrement et que jai rachetée plusieurs fois. Au nez, des parfums de houblon, dalcool et des traces de pêches sont notables. Dans un verre tulipe (Fin du monde), une belle mousse blanche sélève ; elle ne perdure pas autant que celle dune Duvel, notamment. Il ne faut donc pas hésiter à la verser rigoureusement afin de lui donner le beau collet quelle mérite (de là limportance dutiliser un verre idoine). En bouche, on retrouve le bon goût sucré dune triple belge : des notes de pêches, de banane et levure sont perceptibles. Belle finale complexe et équilibrée. Peu damertume en soi. Il est intéressant de laisser tempérer au moins une dizaine de minutes cette bière dont les arômes explosent davantage vers les 8 degrés. Sans aucun doute, avec ce score presque parfait, cette bière est  à essayer et à déguster tranquillement. Bonne dégustation. Cheers!

Aroma is an awkward soft Belgian hop mix with some grain. Taste is a mix of malt, leather, armpit hair, and sugar - making it a badly mixed concoction for a so-called Belgian triple. This is kind of like an orchestra with all the right players, but a conductor and a score who just arent arranging them in the right amounts at the right time.

Poured out a thick bubbly white cap which did fade. The clear bright gold colour may not last once I get to the bottom of the bottle. Spice, yeast, apples, honey, a bit musty, orange, earth, background clove. Good aroma that seems on the sweet side but this doesnt ruin the aroma. Good sweet fruits and just enough spice to hold me over. Apples, honey, white sugar, clove, biting spice on occasion, yeast, lemon rind, damn tasty even if a bit sweeter than I expected. Smooth with perfect carbonation and a tart, malty, mild spice finish. Very good.
Bière blonde extra-forte de 9 % dalcool. Léger col au versement, elle apporte un goût sucré, un goût de sarrasin. Finition légèrement amère, mais pas désagréable.

Bottle. Pours a hazy bright yellow gold with a crazy frothy long-lived head that generates pillowy shapes for the entire glass. Aroma is perfumey pear, sweet wheaty esters, and spice. Flavour profile is sweet biscuity pale malts, dried straw, pear, white grape, elderflower, and gentle spices. Finish is mildly bitter and peppery. This is normally not a style I gravitate to, but this beer was exceptional.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Très gouteuse. Aussi bonne que la double. Je trouve quelle goûte la même chose que la don de dieu dUnibroue.

Bottle @ home.  Light yellow/orange appearance with a bit of haziness and a fluffy large-ish off-white head.  Sweet Belgian Tripel aroma with some candy sugar and light hops.  Somewhat like pale malty body with some candy sugar and hints of light colored fruits like apples or pears.  Not as yeasty as some Belgian Tripels and a smooth finish with a tad bit of alcohol.  Above average Abbey Tripel.

Bottle.  Pours hazy gold to light orange with an average to large, frothy white head, medium-short retention with good lacing.  Aroma is average malt (cookie, straw, cereal), light hops (earthy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of candi sugar, ginger, and pepper.  Flavor is heavy malt (bread, cookie, straw, cereal), light hops (spicy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of alcohol, pepper, ginger, and candi sugar.  Full body, high warmth and carbonation, low creaminess with a dry and biting finish.  Nice, lively beer.  The sweetness is present but not dominant, and finishes nice and dry, as a Tripel should.

500 ml bottle poured a clear golden yellow with a lasting white head. Aromas of cookie, pineapple, pear anbd light spice. Palate was medium bodied and crisp. Flavors of cookie, citrus, pear and light pineapple with a crisp lingering fruity finish.
For a tripple, quite refined and not nearly as sweet as other half-assed versions. I much prefer this brewerys double. But an enjoyable, drinkable beer.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of Belgian yeast, pepper, coriander, pale malt, and slight banana.  Poured yellow/gold/amber in color with a large, creamy, dense, white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet, and lightly bitter.  Tastes of Belgian yeast, banana, pepper, coriander, candi sugar, malt, and slight spices.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Belgian yeast, coriander, slight fruit, light spice, and slight candi sugar finish.  9%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

gold pour with a thick white head.
aroma is slightly grainy,grassy hop, some lemon and apple fruitiness. A sweet breadiness.
grassy, and lemony fruit in the flavour. hint of light heather honey. Some mineral tones in the finish. Overall, smooth and drinkable though.

Bottle (May 2010 bottling).

Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly to moderately hoppy (herbs, flowers), lightly yeasty (cobwebs, basement), with notes of butter, candy sugar, lemon zest, pepper.

Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

Oof.  Hope you like diacetyl and sugar...this ones quite buttery and way too sweet (and that sharp sugary sweetness lingers on and on and on in the finish...its almost impossible to drink more than a few sips).  Not a good example to say the least.
Clear golden colour. Big frothy white head. Butterscotch aroma. Hint of spices. Clean fresh flavour. A little bit of herbs. Sweet and smooth.

500ml. Pours clear with good carbonation and strong straw colour. this is a super aromatic brew. pretty and floral with all those classic belgian esters. has some fresh cut hay mixed with vanilla. tastes remind of la fin du monde, minus the sourness. Big vanilla and buttescoth notes meld with hoppy fruity notes.

500ml bottle from City Beer in SF.  Excellent appearance - clear bright golden in color with a huge white head sitting on top and good lacing.  The aroma is rather sweet with pale malt notes and big fruitiness, tropical and citrusy with lots of esters and Belgian yeast.  The flavor is also very nicely sweet, but very balanced.  Pale malt base with mango, pineapple, banana, yeast, and just a touch of citrusy hops.  Medium-full bodied and smooth on the mouthfeel with lively carbonation.  Very, very well-done tripel from Charlevoix here.

Bottle from Deppaneur Rahman in Montreal. Pours a very hazy dark golden coluor with a big fluffy white airy head. Nose is yeasty, sweet biscuity notes, light clove honey. Palate is lightly fizzy and playful, a bit of bitterness in the finish. Notes of yeast, more of the sweet biscuity flavours. bit of mustiness and a nice dry finish. Solid.
Bottle. Pours golden with a big white head. Flavor is spicy with candy sugar, citrus/fruits, and yeast. Tasty.

Lemon-gold pour with big foamy white head. Aroma is fruit and sweet belgian yeast.
Flavor is yeast, slight citrus hop bitterness and more fruit.
Good, but not as good as expected after having DVs Dubbel.

Pour is a clear yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is spicy, sugary and very yeasty.  Flavor is a big up front citrus fruit with some banana and clove with again a very nice yeasty profile.  This is a stellar triple from the great white north.

Bottle from joshuahfl. Pours hazy gold with a 5 finger foamy off-white head. Kandi aroma - mild though. Med body/creamyfrothy carb. Flavor is very spice with kandi and some herby hop. Its quite mellow, and for the first time I begin to comprehend bubble gum. Turns out thats not necessarily a bad thing. With the spice and herb Im finding this a very tasty thing.

500mL bottle, pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of sweet citrus, clove, Belgian yeast and some spices. Full-bodied flavour of citrus, clove and yeast, with a good amount of sweetness - the spices and yeastiness linger on the finish. Full-bodied and great texture.

500ml bottle, hazy yellow color, small but foamy white head. Proper balance of hoppiness & yeast, dry and fizzy and mouth but still complex enough (with spices - cloves and coriander - and citrus) to make you want more and more. Alcohol presence perfectly integrated into the beer. About as good as a quebec brewed trippel is gonna get!

500mL. Pouring a bright hazy, glowing yellow with a massive, bubbly, eggshell white head that is poofy, light with giant ice cream float retention leaving massive webby and poofy lace. Aroma is slight phenolic, high esters, clove, numbing spices, artificial pineapple, tropical mixed drinks. Taste is at first boozy, then spicy, numbing, rich, some warming alcohol. Carbonation and mouthfeel is light, soft, infinitely creamy.

Pours a pale gold with a decent but brief and loose white head. Amazing aroma - white cranberry/apple juice, very sweet. Lovely sweet malting and light coriander with a long lasting mild aftertaste. Coating mouthfeel, decent carbonation. An excellent tripel.

bottle.  bottled 3/17/10 at 11:03.  clear gold under a large fluffy white head.  aroma is yeasty with sweet corn.  very light bodied with moderate carbonation.  flavor is delightfully sweet creamed corn flavors with some vanilla.  9%....really?  would never guess it was that high.  i really enjoyed the flavor of this one.

Bottle share with Andrew56. Fantastic brew. Pours a deep orange-amber with banana, clove, citrus and malt. Lots of flavor though more restrained then I would have liked.  More sweetness then complex flavor. Decent, but not stellar. Still, I am glad I have a few more

16.9 oz bottle.  Clear brassy brown with a fluffy white head.  Nose is ginger, marshmallow, white pepper and rising dough.  Crisp, foamy carb lightens a somewhat syrupy body.  Taste is honey, yeast, rose petals, green banana and dried apricots.  Bitter spicy finish.  An authentic rendition with added complexity.
Orange amber pour with an off white head. Aroma is banana, and sweet caramel. Sweet malt. Flavor is sweet, malty a touch of Belgian spiciness. Pretty ok.

50cl bottle - pours a hazy gold - lively pour - soapy lace - some honey sweetness and overripe banana phenols hit the nose first - candi sugar - underneath the sweetness is lurking a complex spice and herb combination (white pepper, sage, thyme, mint) - very inviting - the carbonation is a but too full in the mouth, and gets a little abrasive at times - a lot of clean sugar sweetness throughout - a bit of banana and overripe apple - from the middle through the finish it is actually quite spicy, with quite a bit of the herbal character that is present in the aroma - gets a touch peppery - moderate bitterness on the tail end - however, the sweetness lingers on through all of this, overstaying its welcome - if the beer dried out more as the herb and spicy character started to come to the fore, this would be a lot better - still, a really solid attempt at a difficult to brew style.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 Bouteille 500 ml. 9%. Couleur jaune or dorée. Mousse blanche fine. Arôme de levure, malt et agrumes. En bouche, ronde, et sucrée. Notes dépices et dagrumes, de miel. Une bière de très grande qualité.

500ml bottle 
9.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on August 18, 2010 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The beer poured a hazy dark gold colour with a generous white head that lasted. The aroma was yeast, citrus, and malt. The mouthfeel was medium bodied and medium carbonation and creamy. The flavour was yeasty, peppery, malty, with some citrusy hints.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2011 500ml bottle. Clear dark golden pour with mountains of white head that leaves a sticky lace down the glass. Lively tropical fruit, spice and bread on the nose with a hint of alcohol. Nice creamy texture. Tropical fruit with a bready edge on the palate. Finishes with a warm sweetness.

Bottle at Churchkey, recommendation of Greg - thanks!  Golden color, huge white fluffy head.  Aroma of very subtle licorice.  Taste is slightly sweet, slightly peppery, decent malt, subtle vanilla.  Classic example of the style.
Bière blanche de type des bières blanches dabbaye. Beau collet de mousse, et forte en alcool.

Aroma : Spices. Maybe a little bread and as expected, a good dose of Belgian yeast. Slightly fruity.
Appearance : Clear golden with loads of white foam that lasts most of the glass.
Taste : Great malt presence. Quite yeasty with little fruity esthers and a slightly bitter finish. Herbal hops. Quite spicy brew.Alcohol is very well hidden.
Mouthfeel : Just thick enough and well carbonated.
Overall : Well balanced. A great, spicy Tripel. I didnt expect less from Charlevoix.

16.9 oz bottle served in a tulip.  Pour is a hazy, tarnished gold with three fingers of thick, self supporting head; this also sports a very unique and elegant bubbly lacing all over the glass.  Nose is lots of clove, Belgian yeast, light bananas, light hops, and a sweet rock candy sugar.  Taste is primarily cloves and bananas that fades into a sweet and bitter hop finish.  This brew is tasty, but I would have enjoyed the cloves/spices to be toned down a bit.  I must note that despite being quite strong, the spices come and recede mildly ... it is quite unique.
Big baking spice aroma typical of the series.  Flavor  has more of the spice, but gets a bit astringent towards the finish, slightly spoiling an otherwise excellent beer.

Bottle. Golden beer with a huge off-white head. Esters and yeast aroma with light earth. Tropical fruit and yeast flavor with light spice. Medium bodied. Finishes dry. Tropical fruit and yeast lingers with spice and light earth.

Bought at the Dépanneur À Tout Prix in Laval, Quebec. Pours a hazy caramel colour with hints of orange. Nice creamy off-white head with excellent retention and vivid tiny bubbles carbonation. The nose is mild with Belgian yeast and some spice. Nice creamy thick lace and medium to full-bodied. The taste is also quite mild, with the alcohol well-hidden. Good spicy flavours (like cloves) with the Belgian yeast, bread, caramel malt and decent sweetness. This is a great Tripel for this Canadian micro.

Pours a very active big white puffy head over deep gold sticky body. Aromas of vanilla pear and spice. Taste repeats aromas with concentrated fruit sweetness that grips the palate. Some bubble-gum and candy citrus and grape. - very intriguing and Muscat-like beer that some will find too sweet but its nice in that dessert-wine way.
pours somewhat hazy golden with a lasting white head. aroma is fresh citrus and yeast.  sparkling mouthfeel.  tart, almost sour taste with strong hops and notes of grapefruit peel.  dry finish.
Good triple!  Had it for 6 months, bottle is in all french, 500ml.  A dark golden color, frothy white head.  A bit of spice, medium in mouthfeel, hints of citruis.  Good solid triple.

Bouteille oubliée depuis des mois dans la chambre froide.  Bière blonde avec une bonne tête blanche.  Le nez est poivré avec un retour dorange et/ou de pêche.   Présence nette de lalcool.   En bouche, fusion des épices piquantes, des fruits et de lalcool.   Le liquide est de densité moyenne, très pétillant et offre en finale une amertume soulignée par le houblon et la levure.  Texture quelque peu crémeuse en bouche et sensation agréable de chaleur libérée par le degré dalcool.

6-months-old bottle.  Very well balanced, one of my favorites in this style, full-bodied, with notes of honey, herbs and spices.  Conservative but enjoyable hop presence.  Hints of citrus.  Long aftertaste, quite spicy.  Great beer.  I often prefer dubbels to tripels but not for this brewer.  But I liked it a little less when it got warmer...

500ml bottle from Marché des Saveurs. pours a light gold, with a thick foamy white head. aroma is sweet. apricot, citrus and spices. taste is intense. lots of spices and hops, slightly tart. heavy bodied with lots of carbonation, a solid triple.
