Aroma is fruits along with some slight yeast and mild spicyness. Flavour is fruits, spices, some slight alcohol and mild herbal and grassy notes as well. Quite refreshing and easy to drink Tripel.

Poured a golden straw color with aggressive frothy white head;  very effervescent.  Crisp wheat scent with a bright, slightly acidic character in the nose.  Smooth and comforting on the palate, despite its apparent high carbonation level.  Nice citrus touch with a subtle bitterness in the finish that is quite thirst quenching.  Alcohol is barely discernible, just the faintest heat left on the tongue after each sip.  Another great example of brewing expertise!

Bottle 10.01.19 : 500 ml bottle. Clear Golden super fizzy and huge head. Aroma pear, peaches and spice. Flavour cereal, and some spices but these are well used and not to prominent. Theres no alcohol bit the texture is pleasant its thin to med in body. Super smooth and easy to drink.

From a 500ml brown bottle bought at Marché Lavigne.

This Triple has a nice golden colour with a nice foamy head that last til the end of the glass. It has a nice hops and spice nose. The taste is very clean, some spices. The alcohol is not perceptible. The finish is dry.

This is a nice Triple.

Slightly hazy deep gold with a tall fluffy white head. Aroma of apricots and other sweet fruits with some bready yeastyness. Taste of alcohol is fairly prominent with yeast and fruit flavours as well. The carbonation is mid to high without a great balance on the palate. Enjoyable but not perfect.
Very good beer but found there was more alcohol bite than the opportunity for the flavours to come through.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2009 Bottle. Well retained white foamy head. Aroma is delicious sweet whetiness, spices, citrus, flowers and mild lemon. Great taste of warm spice, sweet bread and a bit strawberry (not sure). Moutfeel is good full and quite warming.

Thanks to Dany for the bottle!  Exploded out of the bottle and poured milky medium orange with a tall, well-retained, sticky cap of white head.. lovely lacing on the glass.  The aroma picked up a lovely array of earthy spices and tart, fresh lemon zest over sourdough bread.. warmth brought out a fresh floral bouquet.. excellent presentation.  The flavor held up well.. bready notes and a touch of cane sugar at the core, surrounded by tart lemon zest, white pepper, and earth.. finished warm, but not hot with great balance between the components.  Medium-bodied and very well carbonated on the palate.. balance was spot on, leaving a dry, tart, spicy finish.. excellent brew all around!

Peachy orange yellow; bubbly, thick beige head. Sweet aroma, bread, alcohol, peachy fruit notes, yeast. Flavor shows delicately spicy hops up front. Alcohol - doesnt quite go overboard here, but close (I realize Im a little sensitive to this). Rather a balanced tripel in every sense. Lively appearance, good tasting water, malt, hops, yeast, with moderate carbonation and alcohol.
Bottle (Thanks Mikkel) - shared with Mette, Kasper, Jørgen & Jesper. Clear golden - white head. Alcoholic, zesty, hoppy, sharpness, grassy, honey, licorice, yeasty, spicy, phenols, light caramel.

Bottle at Nørrebro Bryghus, thanks to Theis and Mette.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of spices, yeast and overriped fruits.
Fruity flavour pf spices, yeast, hops and grass.
Dry hoppy finish.

50 cL bottle, courtesy of Theis and Mette. Pours hazy to cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, yeasty, slight vegetable like and spiced aroma. Mild sweet, caramelish and phenolic yeasty fruity flavoured. Spiced and phenolic finish, very classic. Ends dry and lingering caramel and spiced flavoured.
Pours gold into a trappist glass. White head quickly dissipates to skim surface. Caramel aromas. Sweet and dry with honey and alcohol.

Bottle. {[thank you, Boutip]
Pours muddy, pale orange with a massive, impressive, creamy white head. Aroma has brett, yeast, bananas, green apples, bready malts. Medium carbonation, lovely dry mouthfeel. Flavour has good brett notes, bready malty sweetness, lots of green apples, light yeast, cloves and coriander and a hint of thyme. The alcohol lends it a nice warming feeling near the end. This is one truly nice non-Belgian Tripel.
Golden pour, nice frothy head.  nice yeastiness in the aroma with some banana and clove spice.  Mouth is nice and spicy, smooth palate, nice triple.  hides the alcohol well.

dark gold pour with a frothy pour. Aroma is very yeasty and bready, with trademark belgian spices and a bit of fruit. Flavor is pretty straightfoward- same spices and yeast, and hides the 9% ABV quite well. Nothing complex, but a tasty tripel that was certainly worth bringing back from Montreal.

Opaque gold pour with one finger white froth. Mostly citrus in the aroma with a significant amount of spice. Lots of sugary sweetness and light nectar fruits. Flavor is citrus with lots of clove and coriander. Sweetness in the beginning with a drier, lemony finish. Palate is medium with high soothing carbonation. A nice example of the style.

.5 liter bottle brought back from Montreal.  Pours a fairly deep copper- slight haze with a medium lasting foamy white head- and some lace.  Aroma is doughy malts, light phenols, Belgian spicy yeast- but kept in check- fruits are really kept in check, only slight apple and pear with a light grassy note.  Flavor is bready dough, moderately bready sweet, earthy with almost a mushroom flavor, doughy- cookie dough and toffee, light green- ness, earthy licorice root, and a soft finish.  Pretty solid Tripel, but nothing outstanding- has some good unique things going on though.

Green apple aroma right after pour, then some orange, coriander, and alcohol in the nose.
Appearance is medium copper, a little dark for a tripel but also surprisingly clear for a bottle conditioned beer.
Taste is sweet and spicy with toffee notes and warming alcohol. Noticeable bitterness.
Overall very enjoyable. The color is definitely too dark for a tripel, but really, I could not care less as this is very good stuff.
excellent aroma of hops, citrus fruit, and a sharp yeast. Great flavor of citrus hops,and more citrus fruit. Super refreshing,and dangerously easy drinkingfor 9%

Dark golden with a huge foamy head and excellent retention. Aroma is apple, yeast, rich malt, some caramel, grapes pears, and hops. Flavor is more intense than the aroma with more caramel than expected, maple réduit, candi sugar, some spices, yeast, herbal hops and apple with a long bitter and sweet finish..Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. A very good triple.
Golden robe crowned by a rich foamy white head. Aroma of grapefruits, spices and coriander. Typical tripel taste full of pepper, yeast and fruits. Nicely done.
Rich golden pour with a small creamy white head.Yeast, honey and coriander on the nose.  Flavor is full of yeast, honey, fruit, spices,  and a hint of cookies.  Good stuff!

Bottle, thx Daknole. Bright golden with small tight white head. Not a big puffy head. Aroma is clean with some heat in it, punchy. Also white-skinned tropical fruit in the realm of lychee, starfruit or Asian pear. High carbonation but nice body. Great flavors. Grainy background with strong, dry fruity overtones. Has definite mace spice flavors. Strong, clean, and lovely dry tripel.

500ml bottle from Monde des bières. Pours orange-yellow. Huge white head persistent and fluffy. Spicy, citrusy and malty aroma. Taste of fruity oranges, quite alcoholic but not too much. Some coriander as well. A bit dry on the finish and small amount of bitterness as well. Fresh and crisp. Nice beer, nice brewery ! Rating #44

Bottle, from Terroirs in Montreal.  Pours pale gold with huge fluffy ivory head.  Sits clear as a glass marble.  Aroma of biscuit, soap, yeast, and faint prickly-pear.  Flavor is smooth and extremely well balanced.  The forward soapy notes where complemented by a mild fruity sweetness, followed by a slightly tart mid-palate.  Beer finishes spicy, with lemon, sugar, and soap.  Beautifully balanced, with a smooth, drinkable palate.  Alcohol flavor is not hidden, but instead effectively used as an element of flavor.

Dégusté dans le verre de la micro-brasserie de charlevoix. Bière de couleur mangue ambré, soyeuse et bien carbonisé, la mousse colle bien et est moyennement épaise. Senteur d’agrume,
d’épices, de poivre, de levure et de pelure de pomme. Les épices se dévoilent bien mieux tempéré, Le clou de giroffe et l’ananas apparaissent suivis de la banane et la pomme se fixe plus précis sur la pomme verte et on lui ajoute un peu de coriande.Un goût franc ,soyeux et onctueux avec une finition sec rappelant l’amertume. l’alcool est présente et rempli bien sa tâche. Un goût d’agrume se situant entre fin du monde et une don de dieu. La pêche se frêle un chemin entre l’agrume citroné et l’amertume.Un léger goût de caramel s’établi avec du crêmeux avec une longue finale en réchauffant le liquide. Encore une fois une incontournable des bières au Québec!

500ml bottle, with thanks to Glouglouburp for this great bonus.  Pours a clear yellow golden with a towering fluffy four finger bright white head, excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma is spicy and citrus hops, spicy yeast, and apple.  Flavor is more of the same, with light spice, citrus and fresh tree fruits; more gentle, and a nicely done Tripel and another good one from Charlevoix.  Thanks again Dany!

Biere blonde vraiment tres claire, coiffer  d un beaux collet blanc. Gouts phenoliques de poivre et de clou de girofle. Gout de bublegum. Malter sucrer.
Une des meilleurs triples que j ai bu!

Blond ale, clear, with a beautiful white head. Peppery and clove-like phenols. Also bubblegum. Malty sweet. Probably one of the best tripel I ve drink yet.

500m from Glouglouburp - thanks, Dany! Very nice pour: thick, frothy, golden, and abundant. Fast rising head which, you know, is what we love from a nice tripel. Nose is slightly phenolic, with a lot of spices and aggressive hops coming through too. But somehow I kept getting this mild sense of decay in the nose as well, almost like veggies that were just about to spoil. It wasn’t enough to detract from my enjoyment, but it was enough to note. Anyways, the body is moderate but it’s well hopped and crisply effervescent. Very spicy, almost peppery in a way that balances out the sweet malts. Alcohol well hidden, and not too rich. Finish is semi-dry. Overall, a very solid tripel.

500 ml bottle - thanks to after4ever for sharing; pours light gold with huge foamy head; deep aromas of yeast and lemons; like the others i’ve tried from clarlevoix, the aromas certainly don’t disappoint; flavors fall a little flat though and land on the sweet side of things; very nice though

500. Thanks, Glouglouburp! Wow, the more Charlevoixs I try, the more blown away I am. What a fantastic brewery. This was a great beer, grabbed everyone’s attention and garnered exclamations of delight right from the first sip.  Pours a hazy medium gold under a deep and dense platinum blonde pillowy head. Nice green apple and lightly spicy nose. Fizzy, almost prickly body that’s on the high side of medium (but not big-bodied enough to detract from the anticipated tripel-y crispness). Green apples and spices swirl across the mid-palate, leading to a crisp, lightly sweet finish. This is a *great* beer that hides the alcohol very well.
Odeur qui rapelle Unibroue.  Mousse onctueuse, gout d’alcohol discret pour 9%. Tres épicé.  Same class as Fin Du Monde.

Gorgeous looking beer. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange with a huge rocky white head that showed great retention and lacing. Aroma is sweet and bready with lots of yeast and spices. Hints of fruit in the nose as well. The taste mirrors the sweetness of the smell with more light fruits, mainly lemons and bananas. The mouthfeel is wonderfully smooth with high carbonation just tickling the tongue. This is a very unique take on the style and one that I thoroughly enjoyed. I look forward to trying others from this brewery.

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée chez La Barik (Trois-Rivières, QC). Arôme: Odeur d’agrume avec une pointe d’épices et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un large col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût d’agrumes et d’épices avec une pointe de pêches. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence d’épices en arrière goût. (Rating #1817)

Courtesy beerlando. Golden yellow pour with a small white head that settles quickly. The aroma shows notes of sweet malts, citrus fruits, candy sugar, and a hint of spices. The flavor follows suit with the fruit, caramel, and candy sugar coming through, but with a good amount of spices as well. Medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation. This was a decent tripel, but nothing that sets it apart.

500mL bottle purchased from Jovi in Gatineau.  Pours a hazy, pale gold with lots of fluffy white head.  It gets slightly cloudy when the whole bottle is poured.  Solid yeasty aroma that seems to give away some of the alcohol content.  Flavour is strong and yeasty, with a good peppery bite as it goes down the throat.  Although the flavour is strong, it feels like its missing something (spices?) to make it particularly tasty.

Pours a lightly hazy golden color with a frothy, off-white head.  Spotty lacing marks the glass.  Aromatics include light notes of orchard fruit, light caramel, sweet, bready yeast, coriander, and other light spices.  Theres a touch of floral hoppiness as well.  Flavors are dominated by the sweet yeast, with banana adding further sweetness.  Coriander and clove add their earthy bitterness, but not enough to balance things out entirely.  Medium, slightly syrupy body.  A decent tripel, but nothing outstanding.

Bottle @ ORL throwdown, courtesy of Beerlando. Pours blonde with a fluffy white head. Aroma of cloves, big yeast, bananas, floral hops. Flavor is very sweet, malty and bread, touch of hops in the finish. A good bit of carbonation, keeps it light.

Courtesy Beerlando.  Pours a fairly hazy gold orange, with a small off white head.  Smells of sweet malts and candy sugar, along with some light fruits, and mild spices.  The flavor is much more sweet and sugary than spicy, like most tripels are.  Alot of caramel malt seems to make up most of its flavor characters, with some nice caronation, and a sweet smooth finish.  Not a bad tripel at all.
Throwdown. Sugary malts and slightly vegetal. Sugary flavors and somewhat yeasty. A hint of hops at the finish. Gold color.
pours a straw color medium carbonation malty pepper orange peel coriander floral  honey flavor and aroma pretty nice tripel

500 mL bottle.  Hazy orange-amber with a medium-small foamy white head.  Spicy-fruity (peach, orange) aroma.  The flavour is the same, although a little on the sweet side.  Alcohol is well hidden.  High carbonation, medium body.

Poured a golden color with a big white head. Aroma of spices, candy sugar and yeast. Flavor was much the same and was very smooth and well balanced hiding the alcohol the whole time. Not a bad beer, pretty good compared to belgians also.
Hazy golden body with nice frothy white head.  Aroma is floral and bready with nice spice.  Flavour is rich and smooth thorughout and well balanced.  A very tasty triple.
(Dégusté avec french tickler) Biere blonde avec un collet acceptable. Odeur de fruits, coté fleurale, oranges et bananes. Gout de gomme baloune, une fin sucré, pain, canelle, gingembre. Très évolué.

500mL bottle, courtesy of Glouglouburp.  Thanks, Dany!  Pours a hazy, golden-brown color; off-white head with solid retention and medium-bubbled lacing.  Plenty of esters, breadiness, and lively yellow fruit in the aroma; some mineral bitterness and minimal alcohol poking through.  Lively carbonation.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: lots of breadiness, toasty malts, pepper, and citrus upfront; complex, pleasant tripel notes: dry overall, solid ester and yeast character; very well assembled beer.  Medium finish, showing breadiness, toast, and a touch of dust; some bittering character as well: citrus and minerals.

Bottle from Hull location of La Trappe a Fromage, no date that I could see on the bottle.  Huge fluffy white head, hazy medium yellow, tons of long lasting streaming bubbles.  Soft floral perfumey yeasty aroma, hint of lemon, no sign of alcohol, not terribly spicy.  Taste is good - very candy sugar sweet but not over the top, really nice complimenting spices (coriander, clove), some hops, and yes, slightly tingling burning alcohol, especially in the long finish.  Great lacing as I drink it as well.  Soft yet carbonated body.  A very nice drinkable triple.  Excellent.

Somewhat cloudy golden poor with a sticky small off-white head.  Aromas of coriander, pine, lemon and good variety of hops.  First reaction to this beer is WOW... Very impressive mouthfeel, medium to full body... Excellent balance between bitter and sweet... Nice alcohol finish.  Flavors are mostly like the aromas... lemon zest, citrus fruits... Overall a very good beer and i have to admit, this one impressed me and it is worthy of a true belgian triple.

Boutelle de 500 ml. Une mousse blanche imposante qui refuse de nous quitter surmonte ce liquide de couleur or- soleil . Au nez des arômes de citron, de pamplemousse, de coriandre, de levure, dalcool, de poivre, de zeste dorange et de gomme baloune font vivre un bon moment à mes papilles olfactives. En bouche la bière est moyennement ronde et nous offres des flaveurs de citron, de zeste dorange, de pamplemousse, dananas,  de sucre,  dalcool et de mangue. La finale est poivrée, houblonnée, floral avec une pointe dalcool. Excellent
Pale gold robe with a thin white head. Gentle  citrus aroma, some yeast and some hop. Very tasty and well balanced, Delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2008 Bottle shared by larsga.
Very Belgian style. Sweet apricots, and other soft fruit - too sweet for me, actually.

Huge offwhite head. Hazy yellow body with carbonation. Fruity, peppery, soft metal aroma with notes of spice. Dry-sweet intensely spicy catty fruity taste. Delicate. Notes of soft metal. Very nice. (0.5l bottle traded from glouglouburp.)

Bouteille brune de 500 ml. Nez dalcool avec une touche épicée. Robe paille avec une mousse effervescente. Goût dominé par lalcool avec une présence dépices (coriandre). Arrière-goût dalcool avec une touche sucrée. Une très bonne triple.

500ml brown bottle, sent by Goldorak in a BA CanBIF. Not sure how old ithis bottle is exactly, but ive been holding on to it for about 6 months. Bright golden coloured beer, poured with a large thick white head which settled to a tight creamy cap. Leaves sheets of lacing. Quite aromatic - zesty orange, hoppy notes, honey, slight yeast. Flavour has herbal hop flavours, spicy yeast, wheat and grain, mild sweetness. Alcohol stands out in the finish, also some light bitterness. Medium bodied. Carbonation is tight and fine.

(Bottle)  Pours a lightly hazy golden body with a large rocky white head.  Aroma of mustiness, orange peel, caramel, and cereal.  Flavor of spicy yeast, orange peel, coriander, light ginger, and some honey.

500 ml bottle thanks to Glouglouburp. Poured a nice looking clear golden yellow with a dense fizzy white head. Aroma of yeast, cereal, grain, alcohol and slight grass notes. Flavor was far to much noticable alcohol followed by yeast, bread and grain. Palate was medium bodied with strong carbonation and far to much alcohol warming. This one was just to hot and could have used aging.

Bottle. Average beige creamy head that mostly lasted. Good lacing. Light cloudy mahogany colour. Aroma of star anis, bubblegum, coriander, fruit with spice and caramel notes as well. Medium bodied with a very lively carbonation. Flavour was moderated sweet fruit with light bitter notes as well. Sweet fruity finish.

Pours gold with a white head.  Smells of flowers, pepper, perfume and oranges with touches of grass and hay.  Tastes of citrus, coriander and pepper with some sage and sweet malt.  Mouthfeel is thick with a lemony finish.

500 mL bottle from Joinette (Montreal).
App.:  slightly hazy, med. golden with a white fluffy head.  
 
Aroma:  strong yeast, floral, citrus, honey, spice (coriander).  

Palate:  medium body, effervescent carbonation, slightly astringent.  

Flav.:  honey, spice and citrus.  Sweet but with a hint of tartness, a bit of bitterness to finish.  Malt and cereal are present and the alcohol is nicely integrated.

This is a solid Belgian-style tripel.  I prefer the darker versions, but this is still good.

Bien, une bière qui sort de lordinaire des commerciaux et dautres microbrasseries.  Elle na pas un arrière-goût amer.  Au goût, elle est douce.  Plus on la boit, meilleure est.  Elle perd le mauvais effet de sa première gorgée.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2006 Huge, dense yellowish head; yellow-golden beer with a faint amber shine and high carbonation level. Very outspoken nose of white candi sugar, perfumed and with no doubt coriander - to be artsy Belgy. Way too sweet, way too perfumed syrupy-sugary taste. What is the point of adding tons of totally fermentable sugars if you dont allow them, in one way or another, to ferment out? A "triple"- Flemish strong blonde ought to be bone DRY. Ends in a bit gingery-orangey flavours, and warming up, there remains less and less beer in the corianderjuice. Too thick, too sweet by half; limited alcoholwarming. Not a particulary good interpretation of a Belgian Strong Blonde. Very New World.   Merci quand-même, Luc! 
 I have been informed that this beer actually contains no coriander. There must be some other spice and a very specific yeast, especially. If that last is culprit, I recommend immediate genocide on this infernal race.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2007 (Bottle 50 cl) Pours a hazy, amber golden with an off-white head. Very perfumy aroma of violets and ginger and some coriander. Rather full and alcoholic body. Sweetish, fruity notes, again perfumy patterns and a marked alcohol. Quite interesting really. 290806

A hazy orange beer with an orange head. The aroma is very spicy - especially black peber is noticable, but also with notes of peaches and hints of alcohol. The flavor is very sweet and very spicy - again with black peber, but also notes of oranges, peaches, and alcohol that burns in the throat.

Bottled. Orange coloured. Unclear. Off white small head. Sweetness, yeast, light spice, alcohol and fruit is in this beer. Flavour is grapish, sweet, fruity, yeasty and has a alcoholtouch. Medium bodied. Is sweet and fruity in the end.
Bottled. Hazy pale amber coloured. Flowery and soapy aroma. Very sweet and yeasty flavour. High carbonation level.
500 ml bottle.  Cloudy orangy color.  Thick head.  Great carbonation.  Fruity aroma.  Bitter finish.  Really nice candi sugar taste.  Loved it !!

Bottle, cellared for 2 years. This brew usually pours with a gigantic fluffy head and is heavily carbonated but both features have mellowed; average head, medium carbonaion golden hazy-orange color.Aroma of orange, peach and fresh bread (yeast). Flavor is very sweet, reminds of powdered sugar with a decent bitterness. Palate is full, oily mouthfeel. I must admit I prefer younger samples but it was still a fine tripel.

500 ml bottle. Copper colour with a long  lasting off-white meringue head  with lively carbonation . Spicy aroma of  clove , fruit,  some coriander and alcohol. Fruity and  yeasty flavours with a strong alcohol and  peppery  finish. Medium body, dry and burning mouth feel. This is a good beer, made according to the style  but I found it to be unbalanced with the dominating overly alcohol flavour.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2009 500ml bottle.  Partly cloudy golden body with a huge long lasting white head.  Beautiful.  Pleasant coriander & yeast aroma.  Taste is a nice package of cereal, yeast and coriander.  A bit more hoppy than a typical Belgian (which is a good thing to me).  Alcohol is so well hidden that it is borderline dangerous.  A little less coriander and it would have scored even higher.  The cool thing about a beer called Dominus Vosbicum is that I can fill my cupboard with it and look like an intellectual instead of a drunk.

Bottle.  Dark golden color with bubbles and nice white head.  Yeast and malt aroma.  taste of yeast, malt, alcohol, sugary with a touch of citrus and high carbonation.

Bière de couleur doré foncé avec des bulles dans sa robe et un bon collet blanc.  Odeur de levure et de malt.  Goût de levure, malt, alcool, sucre avec une touche dagrumes et co2 élevé.  Bonne bière

Bottle from Rastacouere. This dark golden ale poured with a moderate off-white head that lasted, eliciting a floral malty aroma. The first sip confirmed that this is a well-crafted tripel style ale. The flavor is initially sweet with a carbonated mouthfeel, but with a more bitter finish. The alcohol is noticeable, but not overwhelming. After a few sips, a peppery spicy characteristic became noticeable.  I thoroughly enjoyed this one.

2004 bottle.  Either from MartinT or purchased by myself at Johanette, cant remember.  Shared with SuIIy on 4/24/06Lively, bottle conditioned pour with tons of sediment left in the bottom of the bottle shows a sparkling, deep copper with plenty of bronze tints, tiny bubbles rising and a large, frothy, fluffy white head that is magnificently well-retained and provides ample lacing.The nose is very clean, with a mildly mineralic yeastiness, soft bubble gum and light lemons providing contrast.  Wheat seems to be present, adding a dignified smoothness with a light creaminess.  Hints of caramel, and just minimally phenolic, with a strong perfuminess on the end perhaps from the alcohol.  Im positive that I couldnt discern this from a motherland trippel if given it blind.  The nose is just so well balanced and with such a clean, fluffy yeast.  Add a bit more yeast and malt complexity and it would be right up there with the best.The flavor, however, is surprisingly much sweeter than the aroma lets on.  Dry biscuit malts from the nose are lost in a strong current of caramel and pils malt sweetness that contains dots of peppery phenols (clove and black pepper being the most distinct) and a bubble gum/cotton candy flavor on the end that is sweet and sugary as well.  Carbonation is very prominent at first, expanding too quickly in the mouth, though providing relief from the heavily sweet malts.  It settles out a bit too loosely, there didnt seem to be much middle ground here.  Bread, dough, pepper and vanilla-meets-honey flavors all abound.  Finish is dried out by the alcohol and light phenols.  Im surprised to see this ranked higher than 8eme Jour, that one seemed, at least to me, to be much more balanced, lively and crisp, while not relying on the alcohol for dryness.

500ml 2004 bottle shared by ClarkVV on 4/24/06. Pours a very hazy dark golden color with a big fluffy white airy head. Nose is yeasty, sweet biscuity notes, light clove honey. palate is lightly fizzy and playful, a bit of bitterness in the finish. Notes of yeast, more of the sweet biscuity flavors. bit of must and a nice dry finish.

Brown bottle, 500 ml; eye: amber with orangey and yellow relections, lightly hazy, quite effervescent, nice persisting white head made up of champagne-style bubbles, nice lacing as well; nose: yeast, banana, spices, citrusy, caramel; mouth: its caramel makes it moderately sweet while its hops makes it lightly bitter, spices, hint of alcohol that appears as pepper, creamy and slightly oitly texture, nice carbonation, long finale where the bitterness and alcohol nicely merge, medium to full body

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml; oeil : ambrée avec des reflets orangés et jaunes, légèrement voilée, très effervescente, belle mousse blanche persistante formée de petites bulles style « champagne », belle dentelle; nez : levure, banane, épices, citronnée, caramel; bouche : son caramel la rend moyennement sucrée tandis que son houblon la rend légèrement amère, épices, pointe dalcool sous la forme de poivre, texture crémeuse et légèrement huileuse, bonne carbonatation, longue finale où lamertume et lalcool ressortent, corps moyen à plein

Hazy amber-orangeish hue, with a frothy white head, the nose is yeasty, citrus fruits, of zesty grapefruit, apple note, touch of spiciness, in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty character, sweet caramelized malt, bready dough, zesty citrusy fruitiness, floral hops, spice notes, an alcoholic warmth, leading towards a flowery hop bitternes finish.

Pours golden with an effervscent body and a big foamy off-white head. Aroma of yeasty esters: notes of bubble gum, honey, cantaloupe, and pears. Some aromatic notes of toasted malts and herbal bitterness are also underlying and subdued. Taste is lightly sweet and yeasty. Notes of herbal citrus, coriander, pepper, and mild fruity aromatics lend themselves to the taste. Notes of spice, light alcohol, with peaches and pears.Mouthfeel is medium bodied with lush, supple carbonation typical of a Belgian beer. No heaviness or sweet stickiness that would detract from this clean tasting tripel. The grist and herbal additions seem in order, now if they could just import some mind-blowing Belgian yeasties they’d have the complete package.
Petit collet durable,  blonde légèrement brumeuse, typique de son style. Arome dépice intéressant. Goût épicé et fruité. Cest bon!

Bottle shared with and courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a hazy orange with a huge lasting foamy white head. This being our fifth Charlevoix of the night we started recognising certain elements that were common to all of them and the aroma made me think "that again!": its spicy (quite peppery), yeasty and with some fruit (citrus) and alcohol. Flavour of yeast, alcohol, malt and hops. Medium bodied. This is a nice attempt at a Tripel, its not quite on but it comes pretty close, this is a brewery to watch.

Good strong taste, with a bitter effect. Just a touch of sweetness, but not over powering. I like the spicy flavor and the alcohol % does not appear so strong. The foam last a long time after it is poured.

Bottle (500ml).  Shared with blankboy, my bottle, via trade with turg.  Poured hazy amber with a huge off-white foamy lasting head.  Aroma has what I now characterize as the "Charlevoix" yeast - funky, peppery, sharp - but theres a lot of lemon juice and tart sparkling wine character too, almost like an unblended lambic - tart, funky, cheesey and acidic, very nice.  Flavour is quite alcoholic, yeast and malt, quite a bitter finish, somwhat candyish but balanced by the spiciness - pretty nice attempt at a tripel.  Mouthfeel is astringent, lively, somewhat sharp and fairly complex - pretty well done, really.
Great Belgian tripel.  Not quite as sweet as Im used to but still a great malty experience.     Smells of spices, tastes smooth.  Big body beer, not bitter or alcoholic.

bottle. pours a hazy orange body with a large fluffy white head and accompanying lace. great aroma - cheese, yeast, bread, bubblegum, dusty pear and apple fruitiness. smooth creamy palate with flavours of dusty pear, spice, and a touch of tartness. alcohol is well balanced by the big flavourful body.  sweet cereal left behind in the finish. very good.

Thanks for sharing Mike, much appreciated. HAzy orange liquid is hiding beneath an off white, frothy cap. Yeasty plums in the nose are very inspiring, and enjoyable. White grapes and apricots, along with some floral spicy notes are also in the air. Plums, grapes, spices and grapefruit all fill the mouth, and satisfy. Finish is warming, and semi-dry. A good tripel, reminding me that Canadian brewers are doing well in their attempt to copy a legendary belgian style. Thanks Mike!

Bouteille-De couleur dorée assez trouble avec une épaisse mousse blanche. Forte odeur dépices. Un goût rappelant les fruits, épices et un fort goût dalcool.-Bottle-Golden one a bit cloudy with a thick white head. Strong odor of spices, fruits ans alcool.

Hazy golden amber ale with a thick creamy off-white head. Sweet alcohol and maple aroma with light orange notes. Good sweet malt base, with smooth orange peels and maple notes, wam alcohol finish. Excellent. Summer 2005.

500ml bottle. Nice dark, almost reddish color. Not too foamy. Very spicy and strong, with a long lasting mouth. Smells rather unusual: acidic. Tasted three times before reviewing but inconsistent taste. (Although, apparently,  the owner of Microbrasserie Charlevoix does not hesitate to restart the whole production if unsatisfied with taste-test which, as a result makes this beer a rare find)

Dark amber in colour... not a good sign for a tripel. The bottle foamed over upon opening... this is not a good sign either. Aromas of dried fruit, sherry, and wet cardboard. Yup.. its oxidized alright. There are some vague tripel flavors struggling to come through the mess, but this beer is gone gone gone. I will try and re-rate this one if I ever get another bottle.

[Bottle 500ml, 14c, 3 months old]
My favorite Dominus Vobiscum!
Nice golden color. Frothy white head that leave marks on  the glass. Corriander dominance to the nose, but not as mush as the white or the amber.  Malty flavor, lightly bitter in the development. nice finish. medium-full body, oily-creamy texture. Very good overall.

Glowing murky golden oragne color.  Sweet coriander and soapy, spicy saison and trippel style scents.  Very sweet flavor, slghtly gritty & fizzy texture, overly sweet cloying syrupy sugar everywhere.  Slightly bitter, overall fairly flavorfull with a pasty, soapy flavor in the lingering finish.
Robe blonde aux reflets cuivrés surmontée dune mousse beige. Arômes de poire et de levure. Saveurs de poivre, dabricot et de banane. Ronde.

Burnt straw body with medium-high carbonation and a loose, sudsy white head. Malty, lightly toasty nose with mild peppery phenols and hints of coriander. Very sweet flavor. Reminds me of sweet potatoes and syrup. No off notes, but poorly attenuated for my taste. Still a fair tripel.
Jai bien aimé cette bière, goût dépices et doranges entre autres. Je lai trouvé cependant un peu trop sucré a mon goût...

500ml bottle. I have had the bottle for ~6 months. Poured at 50° in my new NB worthy glass. Pours hazy orange, gold with a frothy white head that coats the glass. The aroma is bitter orange peels, white pepper, spice, flowers? Smells good. The beer has a full mouthfeel and tastes citrusy sour, peppery, of wildflower honey, with a alcohol backbone. Nice tripel flavors. The finsh adds banana to the killer citrus and spiciness. Finishes bone dry. Thanks to beerbuzzmontreal for this one.

500 ml bottle. Copper colour with a mostly lasting frothy off-white head. Very spicy aroma, with clove, nutmeg, and coriander, plus citrus and banana notes. Fruity, yeasty, and dusty flavours with an alcohol and lightly spicy finish. Medium bodied, dry and burning mouthfeel.

(500ml bottle) Murky amber with large beige head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, orange, some spice, some banana, light raisin.  Taste is sweet, candied orange, caramel, some plum.  Banana in the finish.  Some alcohol.  Medium-full body.  More sweetness and less dryness than you normally expect in a tripel.
Orange amber. Sweet fruit aroma with a sour depth. Grows more delicious with each scent. Flavour is as delicious as the scent. A hint of saltiness. Soft body.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2011 Bottle: Poured a clear orangey brown color ale with an above average head with medium retention. Aroma of strong spices (pepper) and lots of sweetness. Taste is quite spicy again from something resembling pepper but does a good job of mixing with the sweet malt and the dominant Belgian yeast. Body is really full which surprise me a bit and alcohol is not detectable. Above average tripel.
Re-rate 2011: Dranked a 2007 bottle in 2011 - This has wonderfully aged much to my surprise with great notes of apricot jam and very complex pineapple ester.
Thanks to Martin T for this one. Hazy orange body, Thick tightly bubbled white head, creamy mouthfeel w/  notes of vanilla and apricot, this is a nice brew.

Yeasty vanilla nose, dark gold color, low frothy head. Orangy malt with some apricot and corriander. Broad tingly hop bitter across the mouth. Chewy body and an impeccable balance. This is an excellent triple! Thanks MartinT!

MartinT - you must be a great guy :-) Thanks for this nice present to pivo. Nice orange color with golden sparkles. Small layer of a head. Yeast and peaches in the nose also coriander making it a pleasure to sniff this beer. Yeast and alcohol taste. The alcohol is noticable and intense but not agressive. Ripe banana and vanilla taste in the middle with a peppery finish. After the sweetness the spicey finish comes quite nice. I liked it a lot, it*s a great winter beer.

Somewhat hazy golden. Fruity aroma with some alcohol in the nose too. Sweet malt flavor with some spiceyness and some alcohol. This is a good beer, but I found it to be a bit unbalanced with the dominating overly sweet flavor, so I would likely not buy it again.

Aroma:Spicy and fruity...
Appearance:Hazy amber good head....
Flavor:Fruity,spicy,alcohol and small biterness finish.

Bottle... Very hazy, deep, golden ale with a large, frothy, white head. Terrific retention and thick, stratus lacework. Very sweet, fruity, spicy aroma and flavor... nutmeg, lemon zest, fruit cake, overripe banana, black pepper and bubblegum. Full-bodied and creamy with lively carbonation. Lengthy, cloyingly sweet finish. A quality beer, but not my thing. Too sweet and spicy... for me.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2009 Very spicy aroma is full of yeast, white pepper, coriander.  Firm maltiness on the palate, with light spice, lots of yeast and a healthy alcohol finish.  Very good tripel, impeccable balance.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2011 500 ml bottle from the LCBO.  Pale golden pour with a tight white head.  Initially big and rocky, but it falls back pretty quickly.  The aroma is really great.  Lots of bright yeasty spice along with a lean malt base.  Crisp and dry but with lots of yeast character.  A little touch of light mintiness in addition to some light clove and white pepper.  Fresh and very bright.  Herbal and zesty over the top of some fresh light honeyish aroma.  Elegant and subtle.

500 ml bottle thanks beerbuzzmontreal.  Cloudy red-orange beer, thick white head.  Spicy and yeasty aroma.  Coriander and a slight citrusy orange and lemon character come through.  Flavour is spicy with a touch of bubble gum.  Light fruitiness and breadiness, with a touch of black pepper.  .Finishes a bit cidery, however. 
7 4 7 3 13

Yeast, citrus and some malt in the aroma, amber, and a small head. Flavours are citrus, bread and malt. Full bodied, balanced, nice mouthfeel. Very well made! This brewery makes nice stuff. Thank You Radek.
Bottled, thanks Rastacouere! Hazy pale amber. Sweet and almondy. Rich, very malty, some orange and bananaish yeast character. Very flavourful, but too sweet.

Thanks to whoever brought this to the Toronto Christmas Party 04.  Bubblegum, bananna, clove.  Flavor is clovey, yeasty and, as I wrote since Id already had over 20 samples by this point, "beery"  A bit watery on the palate.

Large thanks to Rastacouere for sending this Triple along to me about 8 months ago. 
 This little demon pours a orange-ish amber body and a full but quickly passing ivory head. The aroma and flavor bring colossal notes of fruit, orange blossom honey,  nice yeasty suggestions and a touch of black pepper corn. There is a large insinuation of orange / tangerine zests, causing a sweet and sticky citric nose but with hearty donations of caramel and a light smoky-ness of toffee. Also, a sweet warming assent of the lovingly high abv in the nose and finish of this tasty Triple! The palate is slick and sticky, a bit buttery. Overall, I was more than impressed with this Canadian offering!
Nice triple, hold nicely in the glass. You cant stop bringing it to your nose and smell it. Even with its high alcohol content, you dont feel it.
Pours huge white creamy head, pretty amber look. Sweet, full blown malts acompanioned by alcohol, add touch of yeasts. Smooth mouthfeel, rich, very drinkable for such potent ale .Very pleasant.
Pours a hazy orange-brown with a bubbly head. Fruit, spice and yeast aroma. Sweetish taste with caramel and a bit of spice comes through at the finish.

Aroma is certainly of apple with some sourness.  I also detect hints of smoke in there as well.  Peppery notes as well.  Intriguing.  Moderately hazy amber copper color with floaties.  Unfortnately, there was a quickly dissipating yellowish head.  Very spicy beer.  Quite carbonated.  Somewhat honeylike to start with some oranginess in the middle.  A nice beer.  I like this.  Thanks rasta!

Orange, peppery spiciness and sweet candi sugar in the nose. Amber-brown with fizzy white fully diminishing head. Very sweet flavour with some caramel, candi sugar, alcohol and a light fruitiness with a peppery spiciness in the finish. Carbonation fizzes out, leaving a fairly still mouthfeel and medium body. Bottle.

I wish I could get this on a regular basis, thanks for sharing Jeremy. My sample was orange with yellowish tints letting just a bit of light through. The flavour is weet, but very enjoyable with brown or candi sugar flavours being the most prominent. There are also notes of dark fruits. The alchol is well hidden, but provides a nice warming on the finish.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2011 2011-06-30.Hazy golden amber with a small white head. Yeasty aroma, dry alcohol, modest malt character. Flavour is similar, dry alcohol, lightly fruity character, modest malt with mild caramel and toasted malt notes. 7+ Smooth average palate has a soft carbonation to it which is pleasant but Id prefer more weight to it. Significantly less malty than I remember, which is to its detriment for my tastes. 7/3/7/3/15 - 3.5 Bottle at Volo, Toronto
2004-08-XX. Hazy golden copper with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is sweetly alcoholic and slightly yeasty. Fairly sweet on the palate with some toffee like candi sugar. Touch of alcohol in the finish. Some spice in the profile mixes so beautifully that it didnt really stick out in my mind. Palate is quite nice, with the effervescence making it stupidly easy to drink for such a high octane brew. A very nice, slightly out of the ordinary triple. Id may have to find me another... 8/4/8/4/16  - 4.0 Bottle shared with Mustang3
Very decent smooth orange creme triple. Fruity yeast aroma and taste.Great lace and orange tinge. Mid sip pepper corriander anise. Lemon on aftertaste.

Pours an orange brown with a thick head. Aromas of pepper, apples, corriander and belgian yeast. The flavours were quite full. Pepper, apples, leather, and a fairly good hop bite. Well concealed alcohol.A nice belgian, thanks Rasta!

Hazy rustic orange color with a diminished beige head. Ornage caramel and coriander aromas mix nicely. HInts of licorice and alcohol as it warms and settles. Not really a triple but an enjoyable belgium strong of sorts, mixed between a quad, and a triple. Actually after the last pour, with the yeast, some light qualities towards a triple do emerge. Fruits and spices, licorice and leather. A solid complex ale. A touch heavy and sticky in feel, at least for a triple. A good beer by any other name...  Kudos to Rastacouere.

500ml bottle.  Vibrant ruby-orange with a dense, fully-lasting, cream-coloured head that leaves nice lacing.  Aroma is fruity, yeasty, bready, and spicy with notes of green banana.  Light-to-medium body with a soft, refined mouthfeel.  Fruity flavour is relatively dry and grainy with a lot of orange peel character and quite a peppery, spicy kick at the finish.  Deceptively drinkable considering its strength.  Well-crafted and interesting.

Just short of amazing. Lots of fruit salad in aroma: peaches, apricos, bananas. All of those flavors plus pecans and apples in flavor. Some marshmallow and yeasty notes as well. Mellow, somewhat sticky, grainy, herbal finish. I would love to have more. The only thing I would like better is more wheat/grain essence.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2010 Bottled Mar. 17, 2010: Pale gold. Thick white foam spatters the glass with ornate lacework after each sip. Muddled aroma of sulfur, dusty yeast, candy sugar/rum, pear, and dried pineapple. Floral, herbal hops struggle to overcome the slightly metallic/sulfurous and vanilla cake notes. Touch of gum. Creamy and delicate on the tongue. Slick with an immediate push of gullet-warming alcohol which augments the peppery hop elements. Displays some promising notes of obligatory-to-style Juicy Fruit gum notes at the center, which are clean and fluffy, but that quickly succumbs to an unpleasant metallic zing and overt pear, white grape, and vanilla cake sugariness. Malt remains very clean and supportive as it lends an ever so faint piecrust suggestion. Dab of restrained clove harmoniously fuses with the gum without ever hampering any of the delicacies. Pervasive sulfur taints the characteristically subtle nature of this style with an overwhelming scratchiness which is apparent from start to finish. Closes spicily estery and hoppy yet relentlessly alcoholic and on the sugary side. A bit too sweet, flabby, and alcoholic, but a very respectable stab at one of the more difficult styles to execute. 

Review of 2004 bottle: Unfiltered apricot. Fat and rocky, off-white head with plenty of sticky lacework. Invigorating aroma of coriander, chalk, and juicy esters. Fragrant herbal hop and mineral wafts along with sweet, bready malts. Expansive, creamy carbonation. Becomes feathery soft as it breathes. Spicy anise, coriander, and tight esters in the flavor with a continual citrusy, flowery  expression. Tropical fruits dominate the center, but are delicately balanced with a soft citrusy, pillowy malt anchor. Clean, minty alcohol is the perfect match for the herbal notes. As the fruitiness wanes, a delayed spice surge exudes over a zesty hop/tangy herb anchor. Well-placed candy sugar  matches the sweet maltiness while complementing the  assorted fruits and herbal twang. Finishes velvety soft and moist with a medley of coriander, tangy herbs and juicy citrus flavors. This epitomizes cohesion with its elegance, balance, and complexity. A beautiful Triple. (8, 5, 9, 4, 17 = 4.3)
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle pours dirty amber, quickly diminishing frothy white head, fine yeasty bits floating about, with very little lacing.   Very sweet floral and citrus aroma.   Bubblegum as well.   Forwardly sweet on the tongue, slightly tin flavored, more floral notes.   This isnt quite like any tripel I have had, quite fruity and floral. &nbsp Taste is very consistant with the aroma. &nbsp The 9% is very well hidden.   Decent body, good mouthfeel, quite enjoyable this one is.   Thanks goes out to rastacouere for the trade!

Very appealing amber color with a small head and strong carbonation. Fruity and spicy aroma. Fruity (feels like banana) and spicy (mostly coriander, maybe pepper too) flavors. Very round mouthfeel. I dont think that this beer is a triple, but it is very good.

The beautiful beer poured a hazy amber with a rather large foamy head. Lacing was just fantastic. Top that off with fantastic carbonation. This one was a looker! The nose on this was simply divine. Citrus comes out in the form of lemon or grapefruit. Spices aplenty. Youve got to love coriander. The hop profile is very delectable. Then come the flavors. The hops come roaring out like a madman. Big citrus and bitterness. The coriander blends the hops together fantastically. Very nice yeast background. The alcohol is very well hidden. Palate is nice and sticky, a big body and a bitter finish to a wonderful Triple. Thanks Rastacouere!

Lots of hazy auburn colors, heavy carbonation, full rich creamy tan head. Sticky lacing; top notch for appearance. The aroma is delicious with some sweetness & dry matching. Coriander, citrus, yeast, pilsner malts, hops, fresh, clean, beautiful. The flavor is a tad on the bitter side, very spicy & full of yeast. Good to style, almost no alcohol coming through. The blend here is very classy. Matching the spices, malts, hops, yeast, carbonation, alcohol, dry sweet. Beer nirvana. Finishes with light acidity like lemons with a hoppy coriander bite. Super Yummy! Thanks Rastacouere and Sham!

Mildly hazy copper with a puffy and well-lacing white head.  Spiced almost like a wit in the aroma with plenty of bready Belgian yeast to back it up.  Very smooth and caramely sweet body has a subtle spice to it and good balance.  Finishes semi-sweet, dry and warming, but hides the alcohol fairly well.  A very nice triple that I thank Rastacouere for trading to me.

(500ml bottle0 Pours a medium, white head and a cloudy, copper body. Nose of spiced fruit, somewhat citrus. As with the Ambree - I cannot help but think these are more wheat beers in flavour? Nice weiss finish. Good.
Amazing orange-brown and very cloudy beer. Nice white brew. Complex fruity and spicy (coriander) aroma. The alcohol is perfectly hidden. Long and moderately bitter final. Wonderful beer!!!

500 ml bottle.  Golden bright semi-opacity with a firm snowy topping.  Luscious caramel and orange in the nose, yeast makes it a bit pungent.  Medium body, sweet, rich, earthy, lightly spicy, no alcohol whatsoever.  Nice but missing something -- just a bit dull and flatfooted, with a quick and uninteresting finish.  "Good for the price" I guess, but in a tripel I'm looking for something more.

Pretty nice amber colour  with the yeast and spice I'm coming to expect from this little brewery. Seems like maybe they have a preferred spiciness that is a bit of a signature. This one is malty too and has more citrus evident to me on the nose and flavour. Seems thin for a tripel, sort of a "light" strong ale, although the alcohol is present in a smoothly warming way. Nice.

Deep amber in colour.  Aroma was yeasty, spicy, with oranges, lemons, peaches and pepper.  Flavour was spicy, some alcohol, malt, citrus, yeast, with some cherries and maybe some strawberries.  Finish is very smooth, mild bitterness and dry.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 Plantane esters and crisp pils malt energy... Citrusy herb angles tagging along doughy yeast in a frothy, effervescent body...Alcohol heats up each sip... A wonderfully elegant and perilously drinkable Tripel...

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2004 The color is amazing: a deep orange with a bit of brown. This beer has got fruity and peppery characteristics. No hop and good malt is present. Citrus fruit flavor is very present but well balanced with malt. A very good beer in my opinion. The only problem with it being that it gets sold too fast and the brewery cannot keep up with the demand!

Bottle.  Golden orange color with a laced off-white head.  A strong citrus and orange peel aroma, accented by pepper, corriander, sweet candy, and yeast.  A sweet and slightly dry triple with a nice delicate flavor.  A real treat, thanks, Rastacouere.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2004 Beautiful deep golden color with a fine good-laced white head that stays long, fed by much above average carbonation for a triple. The aroma is malty sweet of caramel and peppery oranges. Very sweet triple with caramelic malt, big orange, apple, alcohol tones. Probably Charlevoix's yeastiest beer (in what I've had anyway). The finish is less interesting, tired hops provides a little wet paperboard bitter taste.
